Name: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
Steps: In a bowl, marinate the sliced beef in soy sauce, oyster sauce, and hoisin sauce for at least 30 minutes.
Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add the marinated beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until cooked. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the remaining tablespoon of oil. Add the broccoli florets, red bell pepper, garlic, and grated ginger. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are crisp-tender.
Return the cooked beef to the skillet and toss to combine with the vegetables.
Serve over cooked rice.

Name: Chicken Parmesan
Steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.
Dredge each chicken breast in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with a mixture of breadcrumbs and grated Parmesan cheese.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and add a bit of olive oil. Cook the chicken breasts for about 3 minutes on each side until golden brown.
Place the browned chicken breasts in a baking dish. Top with marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 25 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve over cooked spaghetti.

Name: Shrimp Scampi
Steps: Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Season the shrimp with salt and black pepper.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and cook for about 1-2 minutes per side until pink and cooked through. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add minced garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in the white wine and lemon juice. Simmer for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Return the cooked shrimp to the skillet and add cooked spaghetti. Toss to combine with the sauce.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve.

Name: Tofu and Vegetable Stir-Fry
Steps: In a bowl, toss the cubed tofu with soy sauce and hoisin sauce. Let marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add the marinated tofu and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until golden and heated through. Remove from skillet and set aside.

In the same skillet, add the remaining tablespoon of oil. Add the sliced bell pepper, zucchini, broccoli, carrots, garlic, and grated ginger. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are crisp-tender.
Return the cooked tofu to the skillet and toss to combine with the vegetables.
Serve over cooked rice.

Name: Beef Stroganoff
Steps: Toss the sliced beef with flour until coated.
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium-high heat. Add the sliced onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and sliced mushrooms. Cook for another 5 minutes, until mushrooms are browned.
Push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and add the coated beef slices. Cook for 2-3 minutes, until browned.
Stir in the Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and beef broth. Simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove the skillet from heat and stir in the sour cream. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve over cooked egg noodles.

Name: Lemon Herb Grilled Chicken
Steps: In a bowl, combine the lemon zest, lemon juice, olive oil, minced garlic, rosemary, and thyme.
Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper. Place them in a resealable plastic bag and pour the marinade over them. Seal the bag and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Grill the chicken for 6-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through and no longer pink in the center.
Let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving.

Name: Eggplant Parmesan
Steps: Place the thinly sliced eggplants in a colander and sprinkle with salt. Let sit for 30 minutes to draw out excess moisture. Pat dry with paper towels.
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In one bowl, combine breadcrumbs and grated Parmesan cheese. In another bowl, beat the eggs.
Dip each eggplant slice into the beaten eggs, then coat with the breadcrumb mixture.
Arrange the coated eggplant slices in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown.
In a baking dish, layer marinara sauce, baked eggplant slices, and mozzarella cheese. Repeat the layers, finishing with a layer of mozzarella on top.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 25 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves.

Name: Miso Glazed Salmon
Steps: In a bowl, whisk together miso paste, sake, mirin, sugar, and soy sauce.
Marinate the salmon fillets in the mixture for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Heat the vegetable oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the salmon fillets for 2 minutes on each side.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 5-7 minutes, or until salmon is cooked to your liking.
Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.

Name: Chickpea and Spinach Curry
Steps: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger. Cook for another 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Stir in the curry powder, cumin, turmeric, and paprika. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add the chickpeas and baby spinach. Cook for 2-3 minutes until spinach is wilted.
Pour in the coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve over cooked rice.

Name: Honey Garlic Shrimp
Steps: In a bowl, whisk together honey, soy sauce, minced garlic, and minced ginger.
Marinate the shrimp in the mixture for at least 30 minutes.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the marinated shrimp and cook for about 1-2 minutes per side until pink and cooked through.
Pour the remaining marinade into the skillet and bring to a simmer. Cook for a few minutes until it thickens slightly.
Serve the shrimp over cooked rice, garnished with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.

Name: Lentil Shepherd's Pie
Steps: Rinse and drain the lentils. Place them in a pot with the vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion, carrots, and celery. Cook for about 5 minutes, until softened.
Add the minced garlic, thyme, and rosemary. Cook for another 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Stir in the cooked lentils and frozen peas. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Transfer the lentil mixture to a baking dish. Spread the mashed potatoes evenly over the top.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.
Serve hot.

Name: Beef Tacos
Ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, for extra heat)
Lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, and any desired toppings
Steps: In a skillet over medium heat, cook the ground beef until browned. Drain excess fat.
Stir in the chili powder, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper (if using), salt, and black pepper. Cook for 2-3 minutes until spices are fragrant.
Add the salsa and cook for another 2 minutes, until heated through.
Warm the corn tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave.
Assemble the tacos with the beef mixture and desired toppings.

Name: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
Steps: In a saucepan, heat the broth over low heat. Keep it warm.
In a large skillet or saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and sliced mushrooms. Cook for another 5 minutes, until mushrooms are browned.
Stir in the Arborio rice and cook for 1-2 minutes until lightly toasted.
Pour in the white wine and cook until it is mostly absorbed.

Begin adding the warm broth, one ladle at a time, stirring constantly and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding the next. Continue this process until the rice is creamy and cooked to your liking (about 18-20 minutes).
Stir in the grated Parmesan cheese and heavy cream. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.

Name: Honey Mustard Glazed Salmon
Steps: In a bowl, whisk together honey, Dijon mustard, and whole grain mustard.
Season the salmon fillets with salt and black pepper.
Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the salmon fillets and cook for 3-4 minutes per side, or until cooked to your liking.
Pour the honey mustard glaze over the salmon during the last minute of cooking, allowing it to thicken slightly.
Serve hot.

Name: Mushroom and Spinach Lasagna
Steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and sliced mushrooms. Cook for another 5 minutes, until mushrooms are browned.
Stir in the baby spinach and cook until wilted.
In a bowl, combine ricotta, mozzarella, and Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and black pepper.
Spread a thin layer of marinara sauce on the bottom of a baking dish. Arrange 3 lasagna noodles over the sauce.
Spread half of the cheese mixture over the noodles, followed by half of the mushroom and spinach mixture.
Repeat with another layer of noodles, cheese mixture, and mushroom-spinach mixture.
Top with a final layer of lasagna noodles and marinara sauce.
Cover with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until heated through and bubbly.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves.

Name: Teriyaki Chicken
Steps: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, mirin, sake (if using), and sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved.
Marinate the chicken breasts in the sauce for at least 30 minutes.
Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Remove chicken from marinade (save the marinade) and cook for 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Pour the marinade into the skillet and bring to a simmer. Cook for a few minutes until it thickens slightly.
Serve the chicken, garnished with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.

Name: Creamy Pesto Pasta
Steps: Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a food processor, combine basil, Parmesan cheese, pine nuts, garlic, and olive oil. Blend until smooth.
In a saucepan, heat the pesto mixture over low heat. Stir in the heavy cream and cook for 2-3 minutes, until heated through.
Toss the cooked pasta with the creamy pesto sauce. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Garnish with halved cherry tomatoes.

Name: Baked Ziti
Steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cook the ziti pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain and return to the pot.
Stir in the marinara sauce, ricotta cheese, and half of the mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and sprinkle the remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese on top.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until heated through and bubbly.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves.

Name: Sesame Orange Chicken
Ingredients: 400g boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
Steps: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, orange juice, honey, sesame oil, minced garlic, and grated ginger.
Marinate the chicken pieces in the mixture for at least 30 minutes.
In a small bowl, mix cornstarch and water to create a slurry.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken and cook for about 5 minutes, or until cooked through.
Pour the marinade into the skillet and bring to a simmer. Gradually add the cornstarch slurry, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens.
Serve the chicken over cooked rice, garnished with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.

Name: Mushroom Risotto
Steps: In a saucepan, heat the broth over low heat. Keep it warm.
In a large skillet or saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and sliced mushrooms. Cook for another 5 minutes, until mushrooms are browned.
Stir in the Arborio rice and cook for 1-2 minutes until lightly toasted.
Pour in the white wine and cook until it is mostly absorbed.

Begin adding the warm broth, one ladle at a time, stirring constantly and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding the next. Continue this process until the rice is creamy and cooked to your liking (about 18-20 minutes).
Stir in the grated Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.

Name: Honey Garlic Glazed Tofu
Steps: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, honey, minced garlic, and minced ginger.
Marinate the tofu cubes in the mixture for at least 30 minutes.
Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the marinated tofu and cook for about 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden and heated through.
Pour the remaining marinade into the skillet and bring to a simmer. Cook for a few minutes until it thickens slightly.
Serve the glazed tofu over cooked rice, garnished with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.
